The Setup

Things that I use. Last updated on 8th February, 2017.

Laptop Setup:

  1. Dell Inspiron 3542, 1TB SSD, 4GB RAM.
  2. Dell MS111 mouse.

Mobile:

  1. Moto G4 Plus. I absolutely love it. It has a great camera and performance, at par with the flagships, if not better.

Audio:

  1. JBL T250SI

For listening to music I have a subscription of Jio music. I extensively use its listen offline feature on mobile. Apart from Rdio, I use Youtube on desktop.

OS: Arch Linux <3

Development: Some of the terminal tools that I use daily:

  • subl3/vim for all my coding
  • Git for version controlling. I put nearly everything in a git repo
  • SCM Breeze for easy git
  • Axel for downloading
  • Autojump for quickly moving around my system
  • A custom terminal prompt called Gitster
  • Whole lot of custom scripts
  • My dotfiles are on GitHub

Browser: Google Chrome with the following must have extensions:

  • Ghostery to block all the social nonsense
  • Motivation for nothing is more motivating than to see your life pass by right in front of your eyes
  • PushBullet for sharing stuff between my mobile devices and laptop
  • Workflowy and Keep for offline note taking

Desktop Apps: The few desktop apps that I do use include:

  • Redshift for it slowly warms the colors of your screen based on the time of day. This helps me work late in the nights without straining my eyes.
  • Banshee Media player.

Photos:

  • Instagram for sharing photos

Social:

  • Twitter for in class entertainment!
  • Facebook messenger and main app
  • Whatsapp for staying in touch
  • Quora. I spend too much of my time here.

Productivity:

  • Google Keep and Any.do for short notes and reminders
  • Workflowy for note taking

Tools:

  • Twilight so that I can sleep
  • Splitwise for splitting bills
  • Google Fit for keeping count of my steps
  • Camscanner for creating soft copies. Highly recommended for students.
Tweet Follow @sukeeshbabu

Some boring lines about the writer:

Knows a bit of PHP, JS, Py. Prefers Py. HN addict. Watches cricket.

Follow him on twitter. He doesn't tweet a lot. Bummer, right?
